In this type of learning, the model is given only input data and has to find patterns and relationships within this data on its own. It doesn't have any pre-existing labels to guide it.

3. Reinforcement Learning: This is a bit like playing a game where you learn by trial and error. You try different moves and get rewards when you do something right and penalties when you do something wrong. The goal is to learn the best strategy to get the most rewards. This is similar to reinforcement learning in machine learning. Here, the model learns by interacting with its environment and receiving rewards or penalties.
